sentences: Meie tõid tahtsid head kodu osta.
Kas sa tahad või mitte? Ta ei tahtnud.
context: Tahtsid is the past tense form of the Estonian verb 'tahtma' which means 'to want' or 'to wish'. It can be used as either second-person singular (you wanted) or third-person plural (they wanted) depending on context. The word shows desire or willingness in a completed action.
